website_summaries.verdict: One of the best bottle cappers you can buy due to its professional design and ease of use.
pros: Bench capper design offers better stability and accuracy than handheld options
Bottler holds the bottle in place for easy pressing
Bottling head can be adjusted for different heights
cons: Too large and cumbersome to use as a portable bottler or for occasional use

customer_reviews.title: Very nice capper, but recommend mounting for best use
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice capper for the money. I followed other brewer's recommendations and spent a little more on a quality capper. I'm happy I did. This one is a solid construction without large amounts of plastic. As others have noted, it does best mounted to a bench or some other platform. I use it unmounted, but it does require support to ensure it doesn't fall over during use. Capping can be a top-heavy experience. Without careful support, the capper can tip over. This isn't a showstopper in terms of use. I'm happy with this capper even when it's unmounted. It just requires some careful attention when capping.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. RemingtonTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: Works Incredibly Well, But You Should Mount the Capper on a Solid Piece of Wood or Work Table
customer_reviews.text: This bench style bottle capper is solid. I have confidence that it will be far more dependable than my old wing style bottle capper. The Colt does a good job of capping bottles, but the user should be prepared to pull down very hard on the lever when capping. UPDATE of 11/19/2017: I mounted the capper on a solid piece of wood, and this made it much easier to cap bottles. I no longer have to pull down hard on the lever when capping. I am sure that you will get the same result if you mount the capper on a work table.
customer_reviews.author: Joe from Beverly Hills

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, but the handle!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built! To make it more stable I ended up screwing it down to a longer piece of wood and attaching a rubber mat underneath to keep it from sliding. I wish the handle was a bit longer for better leverage. Update 11/6/19 I'm in my 60's and after bottling about 50 bottles at a time, the tip of the handle is bruising the palm of my hand! I've wrapped the tip of the handle with foam I had laying around. Now I can't store it locked in the upright position because of the foam! Just wish they had a better/wider rubber handle, or the option to purchase one!
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Made Bottling Tolerable!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a year ago - I've probably bottled six cases of beer in that time. Thrilled to report I've had ZERO problems since day one and hope it lasts for years to come. Will warn that it takes some muscle to operate... always a bit concerned a bottle will break but I haven't broken any so far. If you're like I was, debating on upgrading from the wing capper that came in your beginner's brewing kit, I'd definitely recommend this. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cap every time.
customer_reviews.text: I got a starter kit that came with the standard Red Baron style bottle capper. It was a pain in the butt and some of the caps didn't seal properly. This presses the cap down and crimps it perfectly every time. Its easy to use and makes capping bottles effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Durable. Bolt to a base.
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews before I bought this capper so the first thing I did when I got it was to build an A-frame and then I bolted it under the capper. The legs of the A extend towards you while operating the capper. I have capped 2 batches of beer so far, that is 100 bottles, and it is like a rock. I see no reason why this won’t last for years and years capping bottles.
customer_reviews.author: H T

customer_reviews.title: You have to pull really hard
customer_reviews.text: The spring behind the crown in this thing is very very stiff. To get a good seal, you have to pull down REALLY hard. Like hard enough that you feel like the bottle will break. I've gone back to my wing capper for most bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than my wing capper
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bottled two five gallons batches since I got this thing and it has really sped up the process. It’s much quicker than my wing capper (which broke) and I can easily adjust it for different height bottles. I can’t comment on the durability yet, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: tmil

customer_reviews.title: Get it. Solid
customer_reviews.text: You can break bottles with this but.... once you get the feeling of the slight give which is the crimp your golden. Start with capping water and have a great big metal bowl and towel under the capper. The feeling of the “give” ain’t much but with a small amount of time it’s fast. 10 or more per minute. 4 minutes per 50 bottles with wifey helping
customer_reviews.author: sam mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had come with instructions. I have a hard time getting enough leverage with it on a counter, so I use it on the floor. Crimps the caps on great though! Awesome carbonation in homemade fermented soda and kombucha. Does not work with screw top bottles.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: A joy to use!
customer_reviews.text: A joy to use! I bought this after breaking a bunch of bottles with a wing capper, which freaked me out. (I’ve been brewing for a year and a half). Following other reviewers, I screwed the bench capper to one end of a two-foot long scrap 2x6 from Home Depot. I used it on the floor, and it was so easy that I was worried I wasn’t capping fully. But I pressed down til the lever was about horizontal, maybe a hair more, and after a while you can feel the final pressure. Some caps didn’t seem fully crimped (they looked a little flared), so I re-crimped and they looked better after.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and avoid uncertainty
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We capped 36 bottles today and it worked great. 16 oz with no issues. The 12 oz was a weird dimension so the capper did not lock easily in place. Easily fixed with a .5" wood block. Great seal and easy to use. Would recommend it to anyone bottling brew.
customer_reviews.author: JHarker

customer_reviews.title: It works, throw away your butterfly capper
customer_reviews.text: It seems a little "plastic" in spots. I mounted mine to a flat 1x6 board, and it performs nicely. It only took me about 10 minutes to cap 50 bottles. Additionally, the caps are on much better than my old butterfly capper. The butterfly capper broke some bottles; this is my third time capping over forty bottles, and no broken bottles. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jackmon

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, not cheap or flimsy. Was easy to use and can be adjusted to any size bottle. You will need to put some sort of gripper to keep it in place. There are holes if you wish to permanently fasten it to a bench or table. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Great product but shipper didn't box item
customer_reviews.text: Product works great and so much easier than the plastic handheld gloria capper that came in the beer kit. The gloria capper often tilted as I pressed the levers which would break the bottle or improperly cap the bottle. No tilting issues with this one and less strength required. I deducted a star due to product being delivered without a box and jammed into a snowbank in front of the house. Don't understand why this wasn't boxed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: New or used?
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I was disappointed at how poorly it was packaged. A piece of the plastic was broken off and it looks like it was previously used. The damage appeared to be cosmetic. Well, I still needed to bottle my beer so I used it anyway. It’s getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: S. TERRY

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the job - recommended purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great for Bottling but the magnet that holds the bottle cap in place occasionally comes out of place. It’s usually easy to find (stuck to the last bottle). Otherwise very solid and gets the job done. Will eventually put some adhesive on the magnet to hold into place better.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for developing carbonated beverages. I've already capped more than 200 bottles and it is working very well and appears very durable. Much better than others I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than butterfly style cappers
customer_reviews.text: Once I found the correct hight adjustment it worked great. A little extra pressure at the end completes the crimp. After a few uses you get the feel for it and know when you've gone far enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Harelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Capper
customer_reviews.text: I have capped over 250 bottles with it so far and it has worked well. It requires quite a bit of leverage to seat cap but so far seems to be built to handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bench capper
customer_reviews.text: This is big up grade over the two levers. I have a much higher success rate of properly sealing bottles, even those with the non standard necks, like anchor steam bottles. The biggest disadvantage is that it’s a bit unstable without mounting it. However, I haven’t mounted it and it still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be scared!
customer_reviews.text: Needs a good deal of force to seal the cap to the bottle. I would pull down first to sit the cap on the bottle. I then would lift the handle, line up the cap, and pull down the lever again until you can feel the cap give and crimp correctly. At first I was scared to push down with so much force in fear that the bottle might slip or break. Don’t be scared.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Even a one armed guy can use it.
customer_reviews.text: I have one arm and had to rely on others to help me bottle. With this device, I no longer need to rely on others.
customer_reviews.author: Copper

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use. With significant arthritis in my hands, this makes capping easier and more secure
customer_reviews.author: rosepetals

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used this in 2 batches and its way better and faster than the 2 handed one. I like that you can adjust the height for different size bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Ed  H

customer_reviews.title: Best capper
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other cappers that I have had over the years, this one works the best by far.

customer_reviews.title: Great manual capper
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed a red one from friend before purchasing this one. This is a bit more solid and does a great job sealing standard caps on beer bottles. Fairly light to store away between brewing sessions
customer_reviews.author: tkdgeek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome capper!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve capped about 400 beers so far with this press and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Newman

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Quick and easy to use. Factory tight seal.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wardlaw

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is easy to adjust if using various sized bottles.
customer_reviews.text: We recycle other bottles and they are often different heights. This capper adjusts easily to account for this. Our previous hand capper broke several bottles but this one handled our first brew of about 55 bottles easily with no breaks.

customer_reviews.title: Much easier
customer_reviews.text: I love this capper. It is much easier than my hand capper. I decided to spend the extra 20 bucks to get this one instead of the cheaper ones because it is reinforced at the bar and the extra money was worth it. It feels stronger and much sturdier than the other ones I've seen at my local brew shops.

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this earlier
customer_reviews.text: So much faster and better than the little wing-shaped capper that came with my kit. Bottled 5 gallons, 50 bottles, without messing up one single cap.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I spent the money
customer_reviews.text: So much more easier than the wing capper. I'm glad I spent the money.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Way better than a hand capper. Adjust to any bottle size. Caps founders bottles too!

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Go Wrong With This Product!
customer_reviews.text: By far superior to a hand capper! Makes the bottling process so much more fun!! Exceptional Quality
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Really good caper!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. It's the second one I buy in 4 years so it's pretty sturdy. I use it in about 400 bottles a week.

customer_reviews.title: Great capper without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, bottled over 100 bottles so far and no issues. It doesn't leave any marks on the caps and seems to be built strong enough to last.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. and packaging and service. Is so much better than the butterfly capper. I highly recommend!

customer_reviews.title: do yourself a favor!
customer_reviews.text: excellent quality and a real helper! cut my bottling time to 1/3 of what it was before. highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Little bit hard to get use to but pratice a bit and does well.

customer_reviews.text: Takes about 2-3 presses to get the job done and even then the cap doesn’t seem to be completely on.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change the height and everything sealed great
customer_reviews.text: Bottled 5 gallons in 3 different bottle sizes. Easy to change the height and everything sealed great.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Much better than two-handed capper I was using.
customer_reviews.author: EJA

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have decided on this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and worth the extra cost to have it adjustable. Quality product.

customer_reviews.title: I give it a generous 6+....that's it.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK on the cheap. Great for the green pea. No Woody.

customer_reviews.title: Barely capps
customer_reviews.text: This capper is barely better than the two handed capper I have. It attaches the cap to the bottle but the cap still flares out leaving you with a precarious seal. I don't trust all my work to this product. Returning.

customer_reviews.title: Home Brew Ohio Strong Bench Capper
customer_reviews.text: Bottled two batches of home brew in the past month. Works like designed and quicker that using a double handle capper. No indentions on the caps and no broken bottles mis-haps trying to cap beer bottles. I am glad I purchased this unit.
customer_reviews.author: ojustme

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with product. It’s well made, and functions as described. Easier than the hand held models.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Z

product_meta.title: FastRack Home Brew Ohio Colt Strong Bench Capper, Multicolor
product_meta.description: Colt Bench Capper Solid construction sets this bench capper apart from the competition. This capper has a heavy duty machined (not crimped) zinc crimping cap, weld reinforced shaft, and is fully adjustable using its new trigger adjustments. Unlike some less expensive models of bench capper, this item is intended for long term use and high output operations. Accommodates bottles from 4" to 12" tall including most American champagne bottles. Made in Italy. Note: This capper fits 26mm American bottle caps only, and will not fit larger 29 and 31mm European caps (the optional crimping cups for the other bench cappers do not fit this model)
